answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's the commitment, the commitment to the game plan, first of all, that the coaches give us, and we go out and we execute it.Ã‚Â  We execute at a high level.Ã‚Â  We cover for one another.Ã‚Â  It's not always perfect, but we're communicating and flying around and helping each other, and that's resulted in us being in the position that we're in today.
answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think the additions that we added definitely helped us be able to be more dynamic.Ã‚Â  Adding J.R. and Shump and those guys in there, we kind of changed some of our defensive schemes.Ã‚Â  I think our coaching staff did a great job of doing that and seeing what better fits our team at that point in time. answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Not at all.Ã‚Â  Not at all.Ã‚Â  No matter who's in the lineup for them, we're going to approach the game the same way we did in Game 1 and Game 2, try to attack them defensively, try to make them do things that they don't like to do.Ã‚Â  Even though they're a great offensive team, we just try to keep them off balance, keep pressure on them, make them take contested shots.Ã‚Â  When they drive, contest the shot.Ã‚Â  Versus a high powered offense like them, you really can't stop them, just try to contain them, try to make it tougher on them than they usually see.

answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think with the pieces we had, I felt like, if we continued to get better, we could compete for a Championship.Ã‚Â  I really truly believe that, and I've always preached that around here.Ã‚Â  If we work our championship habits both on and off the floor, we give ourselves the best possible chance to compete.Ã‚Â  Obviously, I still think that today. answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I am aware of the verdict.Ã‚Â  I'm not fully aware of all the details.Ã‚Â  I'm not going to elaborate or comment too much on it because I don't speak upon something that I'm not fully knowledgeable about.Ã‚Â  It's not where I stand.Ã‚Â  Obviously, I'm going to take a look at it and read upon it, and if I get more knowledge about it, then I may give a statement.Ã‚Â  I may say something. answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Violence is not the answer, and it's all about trying to find a solution, for good or for bad.Ã‚Â  In any case, anything that goes on in our world, the only people we should be worried about is the families that's lost loved ones.Ã‚Â  You can't get them back.Ã‚Â  You can never get them back.Ã‚Â  We should worry about the families and how they're doing and things of that nature. For the city of Cleveland, let's use our excitement or whatever passion we have for our sport tomorrow, for the game tomorrow night.Ã‚Â  Bring it tomorrow night.Ã‚Â  As our team, we try to do our best to give it back to them.
answers.9: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think so.Ã‚Â  I think sports in general, no matter what city it is, something that's going through a city that's very dramatic, traumatizing or anything of that case, I think sports is one of the biggest healers in helping a city out. answers.12: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I never felt that I had to do it by myself, even in the past.Ã‚Â  Mentally, I just wasn't who I am today.Ã‚Â  I wasn't asâ€‘â€‘ my hard drive wasn't as big as it is today in the past.Ã‚Â  That's all it comes from. answers.0: IMAN SHUMPERT:Ã‚Â  Well, a lot of the time you seeâ€‘â€‘ you find yourself open, you find guys cheating, and you only got to tell this guy one time that somebody's sinking in a little too much, and he'll find you with that pass, like I said.Ã‚Â  Him snapping the ball at you, there's energy in that ball when you get it.Ã‚Â  You've just got to knock them down because you know, if he keeps driving it, he causes everybody to come in there and make all that traffic.Ã‚Â  Then just get your feet set and knock it down.

answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I'm able to make adjustments throughout the game, just knowing how the defense read and react.Ã‚Â  Obviously, when you've got guys like here, who shot the ball extremely well tonight, the defense starts to go further and further away from the paint, and I'm able to see creases.Ã‚Â  When they react to me, I'm going to find my guys.Ã‚Â  I'm going to know exactly where they're going to be every single time I drive.Ã‚Â  That's just a repetition we have through our practices and watching the film and knowing where your guys are going to be, and they have outlets, and they make themselves presentable, and I just try to put the ball right where it needs to be. I'm able to gauge the game and watch the game and able to replay it back in my mind and understand what I can do to help us win.
answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  That's how the game presented itself.Ã‚Â  When I was attacking, I was seeing guys open.Ã‚Â  When they were bringing two to me, I was seeing guys open.Ã‚Â  Like I said, I have the most confidence, the most confidence in my teammates to make shots and make plays. For me, that's my job is to put energy behind that ball when I'm finding them.Ã‚Â  All they need to do is catch and shoot or catch and drive or make a play, and the game presented that tonight.Ã‚Â  I was able to be aggressive at times getting to the rim, and then there was times where they brought two and three guys towards me, and I was able to find my guys, and they knocked them down.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Why that is, for me, more than scoring, you always get the excitement of two guys being able to benefit from a pass.Ã‚Â  If I score the ball, if I'm in an iso situation where I score the ball, it's just me, and I've always been accustomed to team basketball.Ã‚Â  When I'm able to put pressure on the defense and then make a pass to a teammate and he's able to knock it down, I've always got the excitement of that more than anything. But I have a gift, and that's why I'm able to keep defenses off guard because, you know, they say, okay, we're going to make him score or make him pass.Ã‚Â  They really can't make me do what I don't want to do.Ã‚Â  I go out, and I play the game the right way.Ã‚Â  And whatever that moment, that possession presents itself, I try to do what's best for our team at that very moment.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  We've gotten smarter.Ã‚Â  We've ramped up our communication to a level that, at times throughout the season, I didn't know we could get to, and we're flying around, and we're just helping one another in time of need. It starts with this guy, first of all.Ã‚Â  Look at those allâ€‘defensive teams, and obviously he has a small window with us, but he will be on the allâ€‘defensive team in this league very soon.Ã‚Â  It starts with him, his approach.Ã‚Â  I love the defensive side.Ã‚Â  You have a guy like Dellavedova, who he takes a challenge and Doubleâ€‘T protecting the rim.Ã‚Â  Mozzy as well in the starting lineup tonight.Ã‚Â  And everyone else, everyone takes it seriously. We understand that ultimately, if we want to win long term, we have to defend.Ã‚Â  It's going to give us the best possible chance to win because the ball don't go through the rim all the time, and you have to be able to get stops.Ã‚Â  We've been able to do that thus far in our 4, 10, 12 games in the postseason.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's a total 360 from our last series.Ã‚Â  We were terrible in the third quarter versus the Bulls.Ã‚Â  We understood, if we want to be really good, we have to come out with a little bit more sense of urgency.Ã‚Â  We have to play more pedal to the metal in the third quarter. answers.0: BRON JAMES: What do you mean?
answers.1: BRON JAMES: To improve the game?  I think the game is at an all-time high right now in our league.  I don't see us improving the game or anything right now.  I think the league is great.  Both conferences are doing extremely well.  We just want to continue to grow.
answers.2: BRON JAMES: Well, I think the problem sometimes in sports is everyone -- they want instant success.  And I understand, being a part of the process before, that it takes time.  It takes time for a team to gel.  Especially a new team to gel and come together and build camaraderie.  That's exactly what we're going through. We were going through early season struggles because we didn't know each other both on the floor and off the floor.  But over the last month or so it's clicked.  And I think it has a lot to do with us gaining each other's trust and learning each other, and we've played some really good basketball, winning our last 14 out of 16 before the break.
answers.3: BRON JAMES: Every day we get closer and closer.  I think he's great.  He's handled his first stint in the NBA extremely well so far.  And I'm happy to be playing for him.
answers.4: BRON JAMES: That's what we hope.  That's what we all hope for.
answers.5: BRON JAMES: I think the three pieces we have to start with, J.R., he's given us a knockdown shooter and a defensive guy.  He's very underrated defensively and very underrated with his passing.  Shump is a true professional and only cares about winning.  And that defensive grit he has, we don't have many guys like that in our league.  And that's just added to our success.
answers.6: BRON JAMES: Consistency.  You have to do it over and over and over.  Every year.  It's not just doing it one season or one month.  You have to do it year after year after year.  And you know when teams gun for you and you're still able to produce every single night, I think that's what defines it.
answers.7: BRON JAMES: Absolutely.  Absolutely.  Winning is everything.
answers.8: BRON JAMES: It's obvious; they're winning because of those two guys.  Their motor, their ability to make shots, their ability to have fun, and they -- you can tell they play with so much chemistry and camaraderie because they love each other.  From outside looking in obviously I don't know, but it looks that way.  And everyone just follows their lead.
answers.9: BRON JAMES: Yeah, off camera.
answers.10: BRON JAMES: You get me off camera.
answers.11: BRON JAMES: Nothing but love.  That's all I need.
answers.12: BRON JAMES: I can't tell you.  Because if I tell you, she'll know what I'm getting her.
answers.13: BRON JAMES: Unbelievable pressure, man.  You go out, you do what you were taught, you always go back on your fundamentals, and you play hard.  Everything else will take care of itself.
answers.14: BRON JAMES: I carry a lot of responsibility.  I understand that.  I'm only one man, and I'm going to do the best job I can.  I'm going to leave it out on the floor both on and off the court.  And whatever happens after that I can be satisfied.
answers.15: BRON JAMES: Absolutely.
answers.16: BRON JAMES: Very well.  We communicate every day. FastScripts Transcript by ASAP Sports

answers.0: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think just coming back home, period, even the last four years when I was away, this event always brought me back, and understand what's important, what's important to me.Ã‚Â  I've always, even the last four years, just kind of throughout my professional career, for this moment, during this time.Ã‚ To be here for these kids, to be able to see the smiles on their faces and what they benefit from is the education that they can receive from this and the guidance that they can receive from this, it meant so much to me.Ã‚ So it's not an addâ€‘on because I'm here as a professional now, than it was last year or the year before that or the year before that.
answers.1: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I don't know, man.Ã‚Â  It just hit me.Ã‚Â  Sometimes you just have a feeling.Ã‚Â  Sometimes you kind of just realize what's going on and what's happening.Ã‚Â  It just hit me.Ã‚Â  That's how I was able to kind ofâ€‘â€‘ through the letter, I was just able to speak through the heart, and it came off pretty well, I guess.Ã‚Â  That's what they say.
answers.2: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's pretty amazing.Ã‚Â  It's pretty amazing.Ã‚Â  I'm not going to sit up here and say it's not.Ã‚ To be able to sit up here and say you inspire so many people from the youth toâ€‘â€‘ I heard they got a grandmas club now of 200â€‘plus grandmas now.Ã‚Â  So I'm hitting all ranges as far as inspiration.Ã‚ But to know that you can do things for people and give them hope and give them inspiration throughout a dayâ€‘toâ€‘day basis, it means a lot to me.Ã‚Â  I understand that I'm a role model.Ã‚Â  I understand to these kids I'm more than a role model.Ã‚Â  I'm a super hero to them.Ã‚Â  I'm a father to them.Ã‚Â  I'm a brother to them, and whatever the case they want me to be on that particular day.Ã‚Â  So it's important.
answers.3: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I considered returning home after I got back from my vacation, which was not many days after I decided to actually do it.Ã‚ I let my agent, Rich Paul, kind of handle everything as far as the business because I wanted to kind of get away from the game, and I promised my family that I would take them on a vacation and kind of get away from my phone and not mess with it too much because I knew it was going to happen.Ã‚ So I think, once I got to Vegas from my basketball camp, I just started to kind of narrow down the teams.Ã‚Â  That's when I was able to sit with my agent and talk about the pros and cons of each team that we kind of talked to and narrowed it down.Ã‚Â  I kind of made my decision over those 48 hours, my last 48 hours in Vegas.
answers.4: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Yeah, at the end of the day, I'm a businessman as well, and I know what's going on in our league.Ã‚Â  I don't plan on going nowhere.Ã‚Â  No, I don't haveâ€‘â€‘ I don't have the energy to do it again.
answers.5: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  For the current guys, I'm excited.Ã‚Â  I love Kyrie's game.Ã‚Â  I think he could be one of the best point guards in our league.Ã‚Â  I love the chip on Dion's shoulder.Ã‚Â  Where everyone else looks at it as a negative, I look at it as a positive, and I'm looking forward to getting with him.Ã‚ I love how active Tristan is, both running the floor, both rebounding, setting screens, and finishing at the rim.Ã‚ Obviously, I don't have to comment on Andy.Ã‚Â  You give me nine Andys, and I'll be the tenth guy, I'll be all right.Ã‚Â  I can win.Ã‚ Then the rest of the guys on the team, I positioned us bing able to bring Mike Miller on, one of my favorite teammates, and James Jones from my days in Miami.Ã‚Â  To be able to bring on champions, that helps a lot in the locker room.Ã‚Â  It helps out on the floor because we've been there.Ã‚ The early reports is that we're going to acquire Kevin Love.Ã‚Â  Obviously, it's notâ€‘â€‘ we can't really get too far into it because of the league rules and things of that nature.Ã‚Â  We don't know for sure.Ã‚Â  I'm not getting my hopes too high on it right now because I don't know what could happen from now until the 20â€‘â€‘ what is it?Ã‚Â  You know it better than me.
answers.6: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Yeah, the 23rd.Ã‚Â  So at the 23rd mark, if he comes aboard and he signs, I can tell you I'm going to be very excited, very excited to have him.Ã‚Â  He's one of those guysâ€‘â€‘ I don't even care about the 26 and 12.Ã‚Â  I care about the basketball IQ.Ã‚Â  His basketball IQ is very, very high.Ã‚ I had the opportunity to spend 32 days with him on the 2012 Olympic team.Ã‚Â  I always told himâ€‘â€‘ it's funny.Ã‚Â  I always told Kevin Love, like you're very good, man.Ã‚Â  Like he always thought I was likeâ€‘â€‘ I got kids.Ã‚Â  I can't reallyâ€‘â€‘ blowing smoke.Ã‚Â  I don't even know if I should say that with the kids.Ã‚Â  Gassing him a little bit.Ã‚ I always told him how he is going to be a reason why we won the gold medal, and he played a huge role for us being undersize as a big with just Tyson, myself, Melo, and Kevin Love.Ã‚ I'm looking forward to it.Ã‚Â  Hopefully, it happens, and everything is done right from a league rule and standard.Ã‚Â  But he's a great piece.
answers.7: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  That is true.
answers.8: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think, first of all, just my presence alone will give back to the city.Ã‚Â  These kids are going to get most of it.Ã‚ When I get on the floor, that's when the city will benefit from me being back because I play the game at a high level.Ã‚Â  I respect the game at a high level, and I'm going to do whatever it takes to help us win.Ã‚ As far as what I do off the court, I'm going to help these kids and lead these kids to become greater than maybe even some of the people in their own household think they can become.Ã‚ I think my presence alone will raise everyone's excitement, and not only in Cleveland, but in Akron and Northeast Ohio.Ã‚Â  But these kids is more important, as far as what I do off the court.
answers.9: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, for me, growing up in a single parent household, everything was earned, and nothing was given to my mother.Ã‚Â  The way she approach life is she doesn't care about anything as long as her son benefits from everything and get whatever she grinds for.Ã‚ That's basically where it came from.Ã‚Â  I seen my mother struggle a lot, and as I saw her struggle, I never wanted for anything. Ã‚Â I have no idea how she did it.Ã‚ Me beingâ€‘â€‘ me having a wife and grandparents around and other helpers around every single day, it's still difficult to be a parent myself, and I got so much assistance and financially assistance as well that my mother nowhere near had, and she was able to do it by herself.Ã‚ So that's where it basically comes from, that everything in our life was earned and not given.
answers.10: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Besides off the court, I gave you what means the most to me.Ã‚Â  On the court, that's what means the most to me.Ã‚Â  It's my drive.Ã‚Â  It's my only drive.Ã‚ Obviously, I understand that it's going to be a process.Ã‚Â  I'm going toâ€‘â€‘ you know, I've returned home, but it's a different situation than when I left it.Ã‚Â  The team that I left, we had been through the grind.Ã‚Â  We had been through the struggles.Ã‚Â  We had lost.Ã‚Â  We had won.Ã‚Â  Never got to the mountaintop, but we've been through so much.Ã‚Â  This is different.Ã‚ So many great pieces on the team, but none of the guys, besides Andy, at this point, even if you include Kevin Love, you know, has been in pressure games in the NBAâ€‘â€‘ and Kevin Love has won a gold medal, I don't discredit that.Ã‚Â  Kyrie has done some great things, but there's not many guys on our roster besides myself, Andy, J.J., and Mike Miller that's done some great things.Ã‚Â  So I'm going to have to teach and lead and inspire those guys.Ã‚ But my number one goal is to win a championship here.Ã‚Â  I think it will be the greatest achievement in my life, as far as on the court.Ã‚Â  Hopefully, Iâ€‘â€‘ that's my goal.Ã‚Â  I've been back in the lab.Ã‚Â  So when I get focused, I really go in.Ã‚Â  So I'm looking forward to the challenge.
answers.11: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's not going to change.Ã‚Â  It's still a process.Ã‚Â  Even my first year in Miami, we went through a process and went through some tough times.Ã‚Â  We were 9â€‘8 at one time, and things didn't look like they were going to get right, and we figured it out, but we still ended up losing The Finals.Ã‚Â  I feel like that catapulted us to win backâ€‘toâ€‘back championships.Ã‚ Even with the veterans that we've brought in, even if we're able to acquire Kevin Love in the two weeks from nowâ€‘â€‘ or less than two weeks, whatever it isâ€‘â€‘ it's still going to be a process.Ã‚Â  I know that.Ã‚Â  I know that firsthand.Ã‚Â  It was a process when I was here in Cleveland to even get to The Finals in '07, get to the Eastern Conference playoffs, get to The Finals in Miami, and we went four straight times, but it was always a process each and every year no matter what you go through.Ã‚ So it's going to be a challenge for us because, like I said, a lot of these guys that's going to be playing big minutes for us haven't been through it.Ã‚Â  They haven't been through it.Ã‚Â  In order to be successful, you've got to have some pitfalls, and I know.Ã‚Â  I know firsthand.Ã‚ To answer your second question, it was just Coach Blatt heard that I was in New York two weeks ago.Ã‚Â  I was shooting a movie, and he stopped by, brought his daughters with him.Ã‚Â  I watched a little bit of the movie.Ã‚Â  He said, I hope you're notâ€‘â€‘ I hope I don't say this, but you might be a better actor than you are a basketball player.Ã‚Â  So that made me get in the gym.Ã‚ So I think he's going to be cool.Ã‚Â  I think Coach is going to be great.Ã‚Â  Obviously, I'm going to spend some more time with him.Ã‚Â  But the first thing I did when I decided to come back, I went online, and I looked up David Blatt's offense because I heard he was an offensive guy.Ã‚Â  I watched all his clips from him coaching at Maccabi, and I kind of broke them down to see how I fit.Ã‚Â  Obviously, I can fit in every position on the floor, so I just watched it Not only Coach Blatt, but also Coach Lue and James Posey and the rest of those guys and Phil Handy.Ã‚Â  There's so many guys on the coaching staff that I'm looking forward to kind of being around.Ã‚ You dropped something.Ã‚Â  That's a Samsung too, by the way.Ã‚Â  I'll tell you, it won't break.Ã‚ I'm looking forward to answers.0: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Oh, I mean, mixed emotions.Ã‚Â  Started off very well as a team.Ã‚Â  We had a great first quarter.Ã‚Â  But from that point on, they were the better team, and that's why they're the champions in 2014.

answers.6: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I would agree.Ã‚Â  They were the much better team.Ã‚Â  That's what team basketball and that's how team basketball should be played.Ã‚Â  You know, it's selfless.Ã‚Â  Guys move, cut, pass, you've got a shot, you take it, but it's all for the team and it's never about the individual.Ã‚Â  That's the brand of basketball, and that's how team basketball should be played.

But everyone is different.
answers.8: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  I mean, we didn't know what to expect when we decided to become teammates years ago.Ã‚Â  We just knew that we felt as individuals that we could do it, that we could put our egos to the side and not care about the individual part of the game and become a great team and become two leaders of that team. We've been successful in the sense of what we tried to accomplish, and that is going to the Finals, and we did it.Ã‚Â  We'd love to be four for four, it just wasn't in the cards for us to be that. DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  I think the biggest thing you can do is first individually.Ã‚Â  There's no "I" in team.Ã‚Â  There is an "I" in individual.Ã‚Â  You have to look at yourself and see what you can bring better to the game to be able to help this team.Ã‚Â  Then as a team we've got to continue to trust and believe in each other, like we've done for four years here, like we've done all season.Ã‚Â  I'm confident that we will do that. I mean, you've just got to look at yourself first, and then after that, we look at each other and see how we can all help each other get better.

Thanks for clarifying that, too, because I had no idea what you were talking about (laughing). FastScripts Transcript by ASAP Sports

questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â Lebron and Dwayne, was it a lack of effort defensively in the first half or execution?
questions.1: Q.Ã‚Â  For both of you, is it more frustration than anger, more anger than frustration?Ã‚Â  What is kind of the mood right now collectively?

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Oh, they jumped on us, and they were the aggressor tonight, and they had us on our heels from the beginning.Ã‚Â  This is something that at this point in the season shouldn't happen, but they were more aggressive an us and they got off to that 41â€‘25 lead at the end of the first.
answers.1: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  A combination.Ã‚Â  Like you said, I mean, they jumped on us early, and that went from â€‘â€‘ to confidence when they didn't miss, and now you're fighting to get back.Ã‚Â  Now you're not playing the rhythm in the way you normally play.Ã‚Â  You're forcing things. So little frustration, but you know that is the nature of the playoffs, man.Ã‚Â  It's not always good.Ã‚Â  As I told you guys before we start, this time of the year it's dark days for us.Ã‚Â  You know, tonight they came in and took care of business on our home floor, which we're a very good team here, but they're a very good team as well.Ã‚Â  So we've just got to learn from it and come out in Game 4 and make the adjustment especially early.
answers.2: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  Yeah, we dug ourselves a pretty big hole.Ã‚Â  But, you know, we're a resilient team.Ã‚Â  We're going to keep fighting.Ã‚Â  I thought third quarter we came out with a lot of energy, the way we'd have loved to start the game.Ã‚Â  Pushed it, got it to like 10. But this team they still had a rhythm going, they made plays as a team to not let us get any closer.Ã‚Â  But we did what we wanted to do out of the timeout.Ã‚Â  We wanted to come out of the first timeout, we wanted to cut the lead, trim it down.Ã‚Â  I think we got it to 12, 13 the first one.Ã‚Â  We cut it within 10 by the end of the quarter, but we couldn't get it as close as we wanted.Ã‚Â  They had a good rhythm going.Ã‚Â  They made shots. Kawhi Leonard was very aggressive tonight, and they just kept us at bay and they put us away.
answers.3: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  The problem is we're down 2 games to 1.Ã‚Â  That is the problem.Ã‚Â  We've got to figure out how to tie it up.
answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I mean, of course.Ã‚Â  I mean, it's The Finals, so everything is magnified.Ã‚Â  You want to win at this point in the season but for us, we will get better from tonight.Ã‚Â  We hate the performance that we put on, but it's 2â€‘1.Ã‚Â  It's not 4â€‘1.Ã‚Â  It's 2â€‘1, and we have to make some adjustments tomorrow. We're going to come in and learn from our mistakes, as we always do after a loss, and get ready and prepared from the beginning.Ã‚Â  You know, this is the last team in the NBA that you can dig yourself a hole against.Ã‚Â  You just can't do it, and we learned from that tonight.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think it was a little bit of everything.Ã‚Â  It was a cumulative of everything.Ã‚Â  Some possessions we played extremely well and they hit shots.Ã‚Â  Some possessions we weren't quite there and they hit shots as well.Ã‚Â  One thing about this team, if you make a mistake, they're going to make you pay, and they made us pay more often than not tonight from some of the mistakes that we made defensively.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I was in a pretty good rhythm tonight as well.Ã‚Â  I just turned the ball over way too much.Ã‚Â  I had two at halftime, I had five in the second half, and some of them were trying to make some plays to my teammates, and some of them were just overdribbling at times. So I've got to do a better job with that for sure.Ã‚Â  It's not surprising that I have a Finals record for something I don't want to have, you know, so there we go.Ã‚Â  It's a new storyline for LeBron.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I don't think we had a lack of urgency.Ã‚Â  Just they were very aggressive and we didn't match that.Ã‚Â  They came in with a desperation that we just didn't match. Just because it's our fourth Finals doesn't mean anything.Ã‚Â  That doesn't guarantee you a win.Ã‚Â  It doesn't guarantee you that you'll be more urgent or less urgent than the next team.Ã‚Â  You just have to prepare for each and every game.Ã‚Â  We've got to have a better performance in Game 4, for sure.Ã‚Â  We definitely can't get behind this team like we did tonight.
answers.8: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  Well, you know, we're going to continue to give him confidence.Ã‚Â  Mario is a big piece of what we do, and we're missing that piece right now, for whatever the reason is.Ã‚Â  But as a team, we're going to continue to give him confidence so when he has his shot, shoot it, take it.Ã‚Â  Defensively, Mario is someone who we depend on to cause havoc, and we need him to do that. He's our guy.Ã‚Â  He's our point guard, you know.Ã‚Â  Obviously, we've all been to the point where we've struggled before, and we're not going to leave him out on the island at all.Ã‚Â  So we're going to continue to pull him in.Ã‚Â  It just takes one.Ã‚Â  It takes one performance, it takes one shot, and things can turn around.Ã‚Â  So as long as he stays confident in himself, he can bounce back from it.
answers.9: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, we want them to run the offense and we want them to defend.Ã‚Â  When they get open looks, we want them to take them with confidence.Ã‚Â  When they have an opportunity, we want them to be aggressive.Ã‚Â  Obviously, with Tony and Patty, those guys are very high motors, so we want them to match that effort. One thing you can't control in the game of basketball if a shot goes in or not, but you can control how you defend.Ã‚Â  You can control how much energy you bring to the game, how much effort you bring to the game.Ã‚Â  If our two point guards do that, we can be okay with that.Ã‚Â  I know our two point guards, they're very passionate.Ã‚Â  They've got a lot of pride.Ã‚Â  And I know they're looking forward to learning from what they did tonight, and trying to be much better in Game 4.
answers.10: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, they spread you out.Ã‚Â  They have multiple guys that can make plays.Ã‚Â  It's kind of like us.Ã‚Â  They share the ball extremely well, and those guys are always in the right spot.Ã‚Â  I mean, if they ran the set and closed their eyes, they know exactly where the guys going to be at.Ã‚Â  It's a system they've been in.Ã‚Â  They do a great job of feeling one another out.Ã‚Â  And every guy that's on the floor can make a play.Ã‚Â  You know, it's very challenging mentally and physically for a defense.Ã‚Â  So you always have to be in tune.
answers.11: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  Well, when they're missing, defense is great.Ã‚Â  When they're making shots, your defense is lackluster.Ã‚Â  You know, it's the nature of the beast.Ã‚Â  Tonight they shot the ball very well.Ã‚Â  We helped them early on by giving them rhythm, and they knocked shots down from there.Ã‚Â  It's things that we've done in previous games.Ã‚Â  You contest them.Ã‚Â  You look and see, Danny Green was 7â€‘forâ€‘8, but only hit one three.Ã‚Â  He got a lot of dribbling and we closed him off the three.Ã‚Â  He went to the basket a lot tonight.Ã‚Â  Little different than what he's done, but that's the job that we're supposed to do. questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â LeBron, for all the heat that you've taken at times for the "right basketball play", how rewarding was it that C.B. knocked down that three?Ã‚Â  And how did you see that play develop?

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Tim, I'm blessed, man.Ã‚Â  That's all I can say.Ã‚Â  This is my fifth appearance in a Finals.Ã‚Â  I'm blessed.Ã‚Â  I was a kid who watched so many Finals appearances and, you know, watched Michael Jordan and watched Shaq and Kobe, is and we watched throwâ€‘back Finals games of Magic and Bird and Isiah and Hakeem in The Finals.Ã‚Â  I just wished maybe I could see the Finals verbiage behind me and be a part of this. answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Yeah, I was a freshman in high school.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I thought it was weird because it wasn't a full NBA season, and I had gotten used to watching full NBA seasons.Ã‚Â  And that's what I started toâ€‘â€‘ I love the game, but that's when I really started to get serious with it.Ã‚Â  So to see, you know, Tim Duncan out there and David Robinson, it was like, win one for David Robinson.Ã‚Â  But Tim Duncan was definitely the premiere player out there on the floor and I think it was huge. answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I can.Ã‚Â  When Timmy D first started they were more of an insideâ€‘out team.Ã‚Â  I think our league was more insideâ€‘out.Ã‚Â  You would work the ball in the post and if you were doubled, you would kick it out and it was a repost, and they had the team to do it David and Timmy.Ã‚Â  I think our league has transformed into a pickâ€‘andâ€‘roll team, an outsideâ€‘in and if you have the luxury of being able to throw it down in the post, it's like an extra bonus.Ã‚Â  For them they have a Hall of Famer to be able to throw it down to when games can get erratic with pickâ€‘andâ€‘roll and spread offenses. title: NBA EASTERN CONFERENCE FINALS: HEAT v PACERS

questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â LeBron and Dwyane, for you guys, it's just hat and Tâ€‘shirt day, but for the Miami Heat, it's their fourth straight trip to the NBA Finals, first time since the '87 Celtics.Ã‚Â  Has the magnitude of the moment hit you guys yet?

answers.0: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  Yeah and no.Ã‚Â  We don't take this for granted, and hopefully our fans in Miami, our supporters don't take this for granted neither.Ã‚Â  This is not something that happens every day. LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Just to piggyâ€‘back off what Dâ€‘Wade said, we don't take this moment for granted.Ã‚Â  We're going to celebrate tonight because it just doesn't happen every year.Ã‚Â  We've been fortunate enough to be a part of this four straight times, and you just can't take these moments for granted. It hasn't really hit us that much yet because I think we're in it.Ã‚Â  I think it will once we're done and we're able to look back at what we were able to accomplish as players, as a franchise.Ã‚Â  I think that's when it will really hit us. We definitely don't take it for granted to be in this position.

answers.12: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Is that a serious question?

In practice Danny would play well for us, but he was behind some veteran guys, myself and Sasha Pavlovic and Delonte West and Mo Williams and Boobie Gibson.Ã‚Â  It was very tough for him to get on the floor.Ã‚Â  Also being a rookie too.Ã‚Â  But I've seen the talent he had.Ã‚Â  He showed the talent when he was in North Carolina.Ã‚Â  Once he got to Pop, Pop gave him confidence.Ã‚Â  You get the opportunity, you go out and make the most of it.
answers.14: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  What I tell Dâ€‘Wade is when he's most in tune with the game, I can see it on his face.Ã‚Â  I think his face just shows where he's at in the game.Ã‚Â  I don't know if it's maybe his knee or maybe frustrated at times or maybe he's just not in the rhythm.Ã‚Â  But I can see it on his face when he's there.Ã‚Â  That's what I told him, even if sometimes you're not in the rhythm, I need to see your face that you're in tune and you're ready for the next possession and ready to move on from whatever is going on. For me as one of the leaders of the team who has the ball in his hands a lot, I have to do my part as well to help them, I guess, get that face, where he feels like he's involved, and where he feels like he's a part of everything that's going on, both offensively and defensively.Ã‚Â  And it helps us out.Ã‚Â  When his energy level is high, his motor is going and his face isâ€‘â€‘ he feels like, he looks like he's in tune, we're a really, really powerful team.
answers.15: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, there's pros and cons with having 48 hours in between games, especially after a loss.Ã‚Â  You think about it a lot and it eats away at you.Ã‚Â  But at the same time it allows you to really pinpoint ways you can get better in the next game.Ã‚Â  We had yesterday, we had today, and we will also use tomorrow, shootaround to continue to, I guess, get more familiar with what the game plan will be tomorrow. So the time definitely helps.Ã‚Â  And the communication, like you said, the communication between the players and the coaches has to be receptive and open and honest in order for the game plan to work, because we have to have everyone on page from the coaching staff to the players once we get on the floor because the game is kind of so fast. I think it's been great for us, these last I don't know how many hours it's been since Game 1.Ã‚Â  But we've used the time, I think, wisely in this case.
answers.16: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  We've had a couple.Ã‚Â  We've had a couple where, you know, the players didn't like the coaches.Ã‚Â  Coaches didn't like the players.Ã‚Â  And I think that's very healthy.Ã‚Â  It happens.Ã‚Â  The coaches want the players to do everything right, and sometimes the players want to do it or believe that they're doing everything right. So we've had film sessions where we both left out of it, I guess, not liking each other, but agreeing on what happened and owning it and seeing the ways we can get it better in the next game.Ã‚Â  And it usually happens during the playoffs. I think everything is just magnified.Ã‚Â  It's more emotions, more everything in the playoffs.Ã‚Â  For a veteran ballclub, we shouldn't sugarcoat anything when it comes to wanting to get better and improving. answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  No, I think as the rounds go on and on, the opponents and the teams that you're facing become better, and we know that.Ã‚Â  We've been able to get better as well.Ã‚Â  We're in the NBA Finals, we can't worry about we're 4â€‘4 in the last eight games.Ã‚Â  We're in the NBA Finals and we have to try to make the most of it.

answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It is tough.Ã‚Â  But it is what it is.Ã‚Â  I put myself in a position to try to do everything for this team, a little bit of everything, and put myself in a position to win.Ã‚Â  It's very challenging mentally, physically.Ã‚Â  But you have to figure out a way to just have will at this point of the season.Ã‚Â  There's not too many days left.Ã‚Â  There's no room for excuses.

answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  He's been in this position multiple times.Ã‚Â  He's a very, very smart player.Ã‚Â  Highâ€‘engine player.Ã‚Â  I think it's very unique for him not to have any turnovers last night versus our defense.Ã‚Â  I think Popâ€‘â€‘ they've been on the same page for so many years, they know the system more than anybody. He does a great job of running their offense and putting himself and putting those guys in position to succeed.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I had some more opportunities where I could have maybe been a little more aggressive or look for my shot.Ã‚Â  But I don't to take away from any plays I made last night.Ã‚Â  I was able to still find my guys for some shots.Ã‚Â  We missed some shots.Ã‚Â  We had some wideâ€‘open clips where I had two defenders guarding me.Ã‚Â  Two plays in the third quarter I was able to find Rio for two open threes that he just missed, two great shots.Ã‚Â  I found CB for four really good looks that he missed, that he's capable of making. My guys are open.Ã‚Â  I've got this far with them, I'm not going to just abandon what I've been doing all year to help us get to this point.Ã‚Â  So I know those guys will be ready to shoot again once they're open.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It was a tough situation.Ã‚Â  He spends countless hours of treatment and whatever you can do to try to just prepare for one game each and every night.Ã‚Â  I've never been in that position, so I can feel for him, but I can't really understand exactly what he's going through.Ã‚Â  You appreciate when someone like that puts their body on the line each and every night when they're not even close to 100%.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think the game will present whatever the game presents itself, opportunities for me to guard Tony.Ã‚Â  If it's early in the game, late in the game, it won't be the full game.Ã‚Â  I think we have confidence in our two point guards.Ã‚Â  There will be times where I match up against him. answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  We just had some very empty possessions where we didn't get to anything.Ã‚Â  Got to some random sets and we had a couple of turnovers that we're not really accustomed to having.Ã‚Â  We played a very efficient game, but in the fourth quarter we kind of got a little sloppy when we're usually really good. We run our offense through CB mostly.Ã‚Â  I get a few sets, but I get a lot of mine off of rebounding, defensive rebounding and Dâ€‘Wade gets a few sets.Ã‚Â  Mostly our offense goes through Chris, either in the elbow action or we run situations where Dâ€‘Wade will come off a flare and CB's manwill drop and help, and CB gets that action where he catches the ball at the elbow. answers.11: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Obviously, we had some empty possessions where we didn't get into any of our sets.Ã‚Â  We had a few turnovers whichâ€‘â€‘ some of them were just unforced.Ã‚Â  We can't have unforced turnovers, especially in The Finals, especially versus a very good Spurs team that's going to come up the other end and execute really well. questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â LeBron, can you take us through Tony's last play and that final possession.

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It was tough.Ã‚Â  You're going to make me go back to that play?Ã‚Â  Tony did everything wrong and did everything right in the same possession.Ã‚Â  He stumbled two or three times, he fell over, and when he fell over, I was like, okay, I'm going to have to tie this ball up.Ã‚Â  He got up and went under my arm.Ã‚Â  I got a great contest, and he even doubleâ€‘pumped it and barely got it off.Ã‚Â  That was the longest 24 seconds that I've been a part of.

They did a good job tonight.

questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â After everything, you've had about an hour to soak it in.Ã‚Â  I know that isn't a whole lot of time, but after all the times you've thought about what this moment feels like, was it better, was it what you envisioned?
questions.1: Q.Ã‚Â  You've spoken so much about growing as a player and growing as a person over the last year.Ã‚Â  Do you think where you are in your life now makes it even that much more special, and is there a pride that it wasn't just growth as a basketball player, but that you're in a better place as a person to really enjoy it now?
questions.2: Q.Ã‚Â  On the podium I thought you said something interesting:Ã‚Â  You said that the worst thing that you heard last year was that you're selfish because you've always prided yourself on being a team player.Ã‚Â  Could you maybe elaborate on that more, hearing that, and how that fueled you.
questions.3: Q.Ã‚Â  In hindsight do you think that your journey to a title eight years later was just the natural growing pains of a player in the league, and maybe we judged you too early and your journey turned out to be almost like Michael's or Isiah's or Dirk Nowitzki's, where they had to wait a while?
questions.4: Q.Ã‚Â  At times you make it look very easy on the court.Ã‚Â  How hard was this to win a championship?
questions.5: Q.Ã‚Â  Right after the final whistle we saw you hugging and talking to Kevin Durant.Ã‚Â  What were you talking about?Ã‚Â  And do you actually feel like the No.1 player in the world right now?
questions.6: Q.Ã‚Â  This question isn't intended to bait you or intended as some negative question, but what would you say to the Cleveland fans tonight that wanted to share this moment with you, wanted to win this championship with you?Ã‚Â  What words would you offer them?

questions.8: Q.Ã‚Â  I wanted to ask you, your journey has taken you to very highs and very lows.Ã‚Â  What have you learned about yourself as a ballplayer and as a man through your journey to the championship?
questions.9: Q.Ã‚Â  Does it make it any more special that you were able to do this in such a condensed season, 66 games, regular season games in four months, back to back to backs?Ã‚Â  It must have gotten real tiring for you.Ã‚Â  Does that make it even more special that it was so frenetic?

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's everything and more.Ã‚Â  You know, I dreamed about this opportunity and this moment for a long time, including last night, including today.Ã‚Â  You know, my dream has become a reality now, and it's the best feeling I ever had.
answers.1: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Absolutely, you said it perfect.Ã‚Â  The fact that I have a family, a fiancÃƒÂ©e, two kids, supporting cast, supporting family, allows meâ€‘â€‘ it took me to go all the way to the top and then hit rock bottom basically to realize what I needed to do as a professional athlete and as a person.Ã‚Â  You know, I'm just happy that I was able to be put back in this position.Ã‚Â  I trusted my instincts, I trusted my habits that I built over the years, and I just got back to just being myself, and I didn't care too much about what anyone said about me.Ã‚Â  I just kind of made my own path, but did it the right way, and I'm happy I was able to do it the right way and do it for myself and not for anyone else.
answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, I heard it a lot.Ã‚Â  Last year I let it affect me.Ã‚Â  I told you guys over and over and over, I was playing to prove people wrong last year, and people would say I was selfish, and that got to me.Ã‚Â  That got to me a lot because I know that this is a team game.Ã‚Â  I know the coaches that I had when I was younger always preached about team.Ã‚Â  There's no "I" in team, and to win a championship, no matter on which level, you have to do it as a team.Ã‚Â  A lot of people were saying I was a selfish person and a selfish player, it got to me.Ã‚Â  All last year I tried to prove people wrong, prove you guys wrong, and it wasn't me.Ã‚Â  At the end of the day, I was basically fighting against myself. The best thing that happened to me last year was us losing The Finals, you know, and me playing the way I played, it was the best thing to ever happen to me in my career because basically I got back to the basics.Ã‚Â  It humbled me.Ã‚Â  I knew what it was going to have to take, and I was going to have to change as a basketball player, and I was going to have to change as a person to get what I wanted. You know, it happened just one year later.
answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It was a journey for myself.Ã‚Â  I don't want to compare it to any other player, but it was definitely a journey.Ã‚Â  Everything that went along with me being a high school prodigy when I was 16 and on the cover of Sports Illustrated, to being drafted and having to be the face of a franchise, everything that came with it, I had to deal with and I had to learn through it.Ã‚Â  No one had went through that journey, so I had to learn on my own.Ã‚Â  All the ups and downs, everything that came along with it, I had to basically figure it out on my own. You know, I'm happy now that eight years later, nine years later since I've been drafted that I can finally say that I'm a champion, and I did it the right way.Ã‚Â  I didn't shortcut anything.Ã‚Â  You know, I put a lot of hard work and dedication in it, and hard work pays off.Ã‚Â  It's a great moment for myself.
answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It was the hardest thing I've ever done as a basketball player, since I picked up a basketball when I was nine years old.Ã‚Â  It's the hardest thing I ever done.Ã‚Â  It's not easy at all.Ã‚Â  You just put a lot of hard work into it, and hopefully one day you hope that it pays off for you.Ã‚Â  You know, this was a testament to that.Ã‚Â  I gave it my all, and it paid off for me tonight.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think Kevin Durant is a hell of a player, one of the best players that we have in this league, hands down.Ã‚Â  I basically told him I was proud of him, everything he achieved this year.Ã‚Â  You know, he's going to use this experience, like I used it, as motivation.Ã‚Â  Hopefully I don't continue to have to run into him because he's that great.Ã‚Â  He's one of the best, on and off the court. In the summertime we worked out together.Ã‚Â  I envisioned it, but I didn't know it was going to happen, but to see a few months later that we was going to meet each other in The Finals, it was a great moment for myself and for him. But as far as your second question, I don't know.Ã‚Â  That's for you guys to write, to say if I'm the best player in the league or the No.1 player in the league.Ã‚Â  All I know is I'm a champion, and that's all that matters.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, right here I'm sitting here as a member of the Miami Heat.Ã‚Â  The hard work and dedication that we put in these last two years to get to this point, I mean, it was unbelievable.Ã‚Â  I wanted to become a champion someday.Ã‚Â  I didn't know exactly when it would happen, but I put in a lot of hard work. For me, I'm happy.Ã‚Â  I'm very excited.Ã‚Â  I'm very happy right now to be a champion.Ã‚Â  Nobody can take that away from me.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, first of all, I think it's a great team.Ã‚Â  Like I said before, we're the two best teams in The Finals.Ã‚Â  They create some unbelievable matchup problems with their attack, Russ and KD and James, and they have Ibaka the shotblocker, the phenomenal presence of Perkins and the list goes on.Ã‚Â  Collison is a bigâ€‘time player, as well. answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  The biggest thing I learned is that you can't control what people say about you, what people think about you.Ã‚Â  You just have to be true to yourself and true to the people that surround you and your loved ones.Ã‚Â  You know, like I said, I put a lot of hard work into this.Ã‚Â  I took one weekâ€‘â€‘ I took, I think, one and a half, maybe two weeks off after we lost the NBA Finals, and I just got in the gym and I got back to the basics. answers.9: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, condensed schedule, 66 games, 82 games, shoot, we could have played one regular season game.Ã‚Â  Hey, man, I'm NBA champion, and it don't matter. Love you guys. FastScripts Transcript by ASAP Sports

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I feel a lot better than I did last night.Ã‚Â  That's clear.Ã‚Â  I'm able to walk up here even better than I did last night when I talked to you guys.Ã‚Â  I'm still a little more because of the muscles just kind of being at an intense level, very tight.Ã‚Â  I'm still sore.Ã‚Â  I was able to get some treatment last night.Ã‚Â  I was able to get some treatment this morning. answers.1: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, my approach won't change and it won't be difficult.Ã‚Â  I have a job to do, and my job is not done.Ã‚Â  You know, I've been very focused, and I'm determined for us to play at a high level.Ã‚Â  So I will make sure my guys are ready for Game 5, and we will be prepared.Ã‚Â  Coach Spo and the coaching staff will give us a great game plan.Ã‚Â  And I'll make sure myself and my teammates are ready to execute it. answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It just slows my mind down.Ã‚Â  It just gives me another outlet.Ã‚Â  Throughout the Playoffs, all you think about is basketball.Ã‚Â  All you want to do is play basketball.Ã‚Â  But at the same time it can become a lot.Ã‚Â  It can become to a point where it's overloading to the mind, and you think about it too much.Ã‚Â  It's hard to get away from it because you're playing every other day, you talk about it every single day, you prepare every single day.Ã‚Â  So being able toâ€‘â€‘ the reading has gave me an opportunity to justfor those couple hours of the day or those 20 minutes, 25 minutes before the game, just gives me an opportunity just to read and think about something else, and get a sense of what else is going on besides the game of basketball.Ã‚Â  It's made me comfortable.Ã‚Â  I'm not saying it's the trick.Ã‚Â  It's just something that I decided to do at the beginning of the postseason, and it's worked for me.
answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I don't remember too much of 2007.Ã‚Â  I know I was young and inexperienced.Ã‚Â  As a team we was inexperienced, and we ran into a San Antonio Spurs team who had already won, I think, three of them to that point, and they had been in that moment, and they showed it.Ã‚Â  So they kind ofâ€‘â€‘ in Game 3 I think we had an opportunity to win that game, but after that game they kind of put us to bed in Game 4. answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  No.Ã‚Â  At the end of the day, coming into this series, thisâ€‘â€‘ you know, I'm a historian of the game and I love the history of the game, so coming into this series, this reminded me of â€‘â€‘ I wasn't able to watch it live, but I know the history of the game, so it reminded me of the '91 Finals of the Bulls and the Lakers.Ã‚Â  The whole world was so excited to finally see Michael Jordan versus Magic Johnson in The Finals.Ã‚Â  They didn't really care about the Lakers and the Bulls going against one another, it was all about Magic and Jordan. answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, for us as a team, he means a lot.Ã‚Â  You know, he put together this team, and we just look at his rÃƒÂ©sumÃƒÂ©.Ã‚Â  We look at his experience either as a player, as a coach or as an executive.Ã‚Â  He's done some great things. answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, the biggest thing is he made a sacrifice to join that team.Ã‚Â  You look at Doo's rÃƒÂ©sumÃƒÂ© before he joined the Lakers, he was multiple MVP, multiple scoring champion, he could score with the best of them.Ã‚Â  But I think he knew that if he was going to be joining the Lakers, he wasn't going to be that same player.Ã‚Â  So he had to make sacrifices. answers.13: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I'm not much of a fouler, personally.Ã‚Â  Our team, coming into the series, knowing Oklahoma City had shotâ€‘â€‘ coming into the series they shot 90 percent from the freeâ€‘throw line.Ã‚Â  So as many attack guys as they have and as well as they score the ball, you can't allow them to not only make tough shots, then also put them on the freeâ€‘throw line.Ã‚Â  You can't give up both. answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I don't know, just trying to make plays.Ã‚Â  I told you guys, last year I didn't make enough gameâ€‘changing plays, and that's what I kind of pride myself on.Ã‚Â  I didn't do that last year in The Finals.Ã‚Â  I'm just trying to make gameâ€‘changing plays, and whatever it takes for our team to win, just trying to step up in key moments and be there for my teammates.
answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, how I was feeling down 10, we weren't playing our game.Ã‚Â  They made us stagnant and they came out in the third quarter and attacked us, and we didn't attack back.Ã‚Â  We did that the last minutes of the third quarter and we was able to cut the lead, I think even taking the lead with D Wade's free throw. We didn't play good to start the third, and we can't do that.Ã‚Â  We can't do that against an explosive team like that.Ã‚Â  But it just shows our character, how we was able to come back from that and make plays and regain the lead.
answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, that's our mindset, period.Ã‚Â  That's just how we play.Ã‚Â  We always feel like we want to grind out games.Ã‚Â  No matter how well we may be shooting the ball from the outside, no matter how many layâ€‘ups or dunks or fastâ€‘break points we get, we always feel it's going to be a grindâ€‘out game especially since we're playing against a great opponent.Ã‚Â  So it was that.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It's not.Ã‚Â  We don't have that mindset.Ã‚Â  Our mindset right now is coming into tomorrow we try to get better.Ã‚Â  We have to get better in Game 4 because everyone makes an adjustments, everyone comes out the next game and does a better job. In the fourth quarter we had an opportunity to extend the lead, and we turned the ball over.Ã‚Â  We turned the ball over nine times in the fourth, I believe, and that's not winning basketball. We know they're not broken.Ã‚Â  For us, we just want to improve.Ã‚Â  We want to improve each and every game, and we look forward to the challenge of Game 4.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, we've got to make big plays.Ã‚Â  You know, we understand our supporting cast is going to be there for us no matter what's going on throughout the game.Ã‚Â  But if the game gets tight, one of the three of us, or all three of us, have to make plays to bring home the win. You know, it was great to see us able to close this game out tonight.Ã‚Â  We had a comfortable lead, but they made a run.Ã‚Â  They made a quick run, cut the lead to one, and then I was able to hit Chris for a layâ€‘up.Ã‚Â  He got fouled, made two free throws, was able to get a stop, and that's what it's about.Ã‚Â  It's about us just trying to step up when our teammates need us the most.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, we felt like they were going to come out aggressive, so I wanted to counter their aggression with aggression.Ã‚Â  Put pressure on the rim offensively or get offensive rebounds, I was able to get five offensive rebounds to give us extra possessions and get some secondâ€‘chance points.Ã‚Â  Looking at the stat sheet, we had 46 points in the paint, 11 secondâ€‘chance points.Ã‚Â  So that's good.Ã‚Â  And also we had 35 free throws.Ã‚Â  That's a really good number for us.Ã‚Â  When we're getting to the freeâ€‘throw line, even when we don't shoot the ball well, that's a plus for us.Ã‚Â  Just always trying to be in aggressive mode and do whatever it takes to help our team come out with a win.
answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, size doesn't matter.Ã‚Â  It's about just will and determination.Ã‚Â  It doesn't matter if someone is taller than you or bigger than you or weighs more than you.Ã‚Â  You just try to put yourself in a position to get rebounds or make plays to help your team.Ã‚Â  That's what it comes down to.Ã‚Â  We don't care about teams being taller than us or I guess, quoteâ€‘unquote, bigger than us.Ã‚Â  Every last one of our guys plays bigger than what their height is, bigger than what their weight is.Ã‚Â  As a team we don't feel like it's a disadvantage whoever we're going against.
answers.9: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Is that a question for me or for them?
answers.10: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It doesn't change me.
answers.11: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, I don't know.Ã‚Â  I mean, if he's on the court or he's off the court, we have to still be aggressive.Ã‚Â  We have to continue to do our play, play our game.Ã‚Â  I think he got it going in the third.Ã‚Â  He made some big shots in the third quarter, gave them the lead.Ã‚Â  His fourth foul on D Wade, we kind of got the momentum from there.Ã‚Â  But he's a great player.Ã‚Â  He's going to make shots.Ã‚Â  But for us, we have to be aggressive no matter if he's on the floor or not.
answers.12: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I wish it was that easy.Ã‚Â  You know, that's a great team we're going against, and defensively they have some very active players, so they kind of bring the doubleâ€‘team sometimes when I'm in the post or if I'm in the perimeter they kind of put two on the ball.Ã‚Â  I just try to take what the defense gives me, try to get into the paint.Ã‚Â  If I can't do it with the ball, just try to be active on the weak side or cutting or getting offensive rebounds or getting putâ€‘backs that way, just try to do a little bit of everything where I'm not just isolating on the post or on the elbow. You know, it's a good mixture of what I have right now, and my teammates do a good job of finding me when I don't have the ball.
answers.13: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, it's absolutely true.Ã‚Â  We talk about it all the time.Ã‚Â  We understand that it's been a great teacher for us, just the experience.Ã‚Â  We don't take things for granted.Ã‚Â  We understand that we accept each challenge as its own, and we know Game 4 is going to be a different game.Ã‚Â  No matter what happened in Game 1, Game 2, Game 3, Game 4 is its own, and we will approach it like that.Ã‚Â  We understand that there's going to be a team that's going to come in and try to get the homeâ€‘court advantage back once again, try to win on our floor.Ã‚Â  But if we do what we need to do defensively, we make them make tough shots, we rebound, and we don't turn the ball over, we give ourselves a good chance to win Game 4.Ã‚Â  Looking forward to it. questions.0: Q. Ã‚Â You've got two guys on the team in Shane Battier and Mario Chalmers who have won college national titles and have a chance to add an NBA ring.Ã‚Â  How cool would it be for those two guys to win a college and NBA ring?Ã‚Â  And do you think it also helps, you've got UD and Dwyane who are champions in the NBA, but having two guys who have won championships in college on the team?
questions.1: Q.Ã‚Â  You guys, especially in the two years you've been here, have really tried to build a homeâ€‘court advantage, make this a special place.Ã‚Â  How has that come around?Ã‚Â  Do you feel that the homeâ€‘court advantage you have here was similar to what you had in Cleveland?Ã‚Â  And based on what the Thunder have at home, how important is it you feel something similar to what their crowd gave them in the first two games?
questions.2: Q.Ã‚Â  There's been this theory about great scorers forever that, okay, you just concede a certain amount of points to them and worry about everybody else.Ã‚Â  I'm sure that's probably been used against you a lot.Ã‚Â  Is KD kind of at that point now where you just know he's going to get 30, and it's more about making sure that guys like Russ and everybody else just don't go off because you know Kevin is going to do what he does?

questions.6: Q.Ã‚Â  What is the difference in your game now when a year ago?Ã‚Â  Is it just a matter of being through this with this team one time and feeling more comfortable, or how much has that really helped you?

answers.0: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, it would be cool, honestly.Ã‚Â  Everyone likes to build and put championships into their rÃƒÂ©sumÃƒÂ©.Ã‚Â  It would be unique, and it would be cool at the same time for them.
answers.1: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, you always want to try to be dominant at home and protect home.Ã‚Â  My days in Cleveland we was very dominant at home in the postseason and in the regular season.Ã‚Â  You want to try to establish that.Ã‚Â  When people come into the building they feel like they're at a disadvantage already before the game starts.Ã‚Â  And our fans here are great, have been great throughout the whole postseason in the last two years, and in Game 7 of the Boston series that just ended, it was the loudest they've been.Ã‚Â  They was very excited about us winning that game and moving onto the Finals.Ã‚Â  So we look forward to seeing them tomorrow.Ã‚Â  And they're going to bring that excitement that they've brought. OKC definitely has a unique fanbase and a great fanbase in OKC.Ã‚Â  It has that college sound, that college feel, and I've never played in a hostile college environment, but I've been to a few games and I know the type of excitement that goes around it.Ã‚Â  They have something great that's there, and we do, as well.
answers.2: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I mean, like you say, you can't stop KD, you just don't try to give him easy ones.Ã‚Â  You don't want to give him an easy dunk in transition where you didn't get back on defense, or you give him a transition D because you didn't communicate and gave up and things like that of course, but he's going to make shots.Ã‚Â  He can make any shot the game has to offer, off the dribble, off the catchâ€‘andâ€‘shoot, off pindowns, he can make every shot.Ã‚Â  You just try to wear on him, but he's going to make his shots and get his points because of the type of player he is. And then you've got to control everybody else.Ã‚Â  Russell is going to get his points, as well, because he's that good of a player.Ã‚Â  He's that talented, as well.Ã‚Â  You just try to make them score, but not score because you had a breakdown or messed up on something.Ã‚Â  If they score over the top or in front of you, then you can live with it.
answers.3: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, when I'm out on the floor I'm enjoying it.Ã‚Â  I'm having fun with these first two games.Ã‚Â  I mean, this is a great opportunity for myself and for our team, for both teams.Ã‚Â  It's a lot of fun being out there and competing at a high level, you know, the intense moment where every possession counts.Ã‚Â  That's what it's all about.Ã‚Â  As a competitor you have to enjoy these moments and you love these moments.
answers.4: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I think from a fan's perspective, I think it's beenâ€‘â€‘ the first two games have been great.Ã‚Â  You know, I've seen some of the ratings, so that shows the excitement around the game of basketball, shows the excitement around the two teams, and what these two teams have to offer.Ã‚Â  You have some great story lines and some individual plays.Ã‚Â  I think it's been great.
answers.5: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I don't know.Ã‚Â  I guess when we're behind and when we're down, that's the best time people like to see us at.Ã‚Â  People like to see us when we're behind and see how we're going to react or make adjustments going into the next game.Ã‚Â  I mean, we've played good ball even when we were up, even in the New York series.Ã‚Â  We played good ball, we lost Game 4, but we was able to win Game 5. I don't know.Ã‚Â  We don't want to be behind (laughing), we're not trying to get down in the series, we can tell you that.Ã‚Â  But it's good to see that we can come back after a little adversity, a little down.
answers.6: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Me personally?Ã‚Â  I'm just more comfortable.Ã‚Â  I mean, I spent seven years basically â€‘â€‘ the last five years in one system.Ã‚Â  I know the ins and outs about that whole system when I was in Cleveland, so I was very comfortable with that situation. A lot of things had to change in my one year here, and I never got fully adjusted throughout the whole year. This year I've just been more comfortable with the team, more comfortable with the system, more comfortable with the city and everything around it.Ã‚Â  Once I get on the floor, I just let my game kind of react for me and everything I've built throughout the years, just go out and do it, and I don't have to worry about anything else.
answers.7: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Like I said, I'm going to go out and make plays for my team throughout the game.Ã‚Â  I'm going to leave it out on the line, and at the end of the day, I'm going to be happy with that. We want to win it, I want to win it, but I only can control what I can control, you know, and that's going out and being there for my teammates throughout the game.Ã‚Â  That's all I care about.
answers.8: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I think Spo has been great.Ã‚Â  I mean, he's been challenged the last two years by a lot of people, but I think he's been awesome.Ã‚Â  Two straight Finals appearances, and he's put us in position to win each and every game.Ã‚Â  You know, and for me, our relationship has grown over the last three years because we've been around each other, we understand what we like, our dislikes, everything of that nature, but he's been great.Ã‚Â  He's going to continue to grow, and I hope I can continue to grow around him.Ã‚Â  But he's been great.Ã‚Â  He's been a great coach.
answers.9: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  No, I just think he's been more open this year, you know, allowing some of the players to voice their opinion on certain situations, either at practice or in a game, no matter what the magnitude of the game is.Ã‚Â  We trust him and he trusts us.Ã‚Â  At the end of the day, he has the last call because he is the head coach, but as a player you love that fact when a coach wants to hear or wants to feel what you may see out on the floor during the game or during the film session.Ã‚Â  He's been awesome.
answers.10: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Yeah, absolutely.Ã‚Â  He does a great job of doing that each and every day, keeping us motivated, keeping us ready for the taking, ready for the next game or just ready for the moment.Ã‚Â  You know, every day, every game he comes in with something, and he gets us prepared, both by Xs and Os on the basketball court and also by other things to prepare us for the game.
answers.11: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, team defense is everything.Ã‚Â  We understand as an individual you want to take the individual challenge, but you also have to have that team defense and that team concept behind you or in front of you or on the side of you.Ã‚Â  You know, because it helps you out individually when you know you have help, if you get beat, which everyone does in this game, or something happens where there's a breakdown, you know that someone behind you is going to protect you.Ã‚Â  That's always key.
answers.12: LeBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Everything.Ã‚Â  Appreciate it. FastScripts Transcript by ASAP Sports

questions.0: Q.Ã‚Â  LeBron, could you just talk about, again, the start your team got off to, 18â€‘2, and how important that was?
questions.1: Q.Ã‚Â  Can you talk about your teammate Shane Battier and the series that he's putting together?Ã‚Â  He's had two great games and just talk about what Battier is doing.
questions.2: Q.Ã‚Â  After winning Game 2, what do you guys feel is most important going into Game 3?

questions.10: Q.Ã‚Â  But that's not like a larger statement about you guys in the fourth quarter, that's just one game?

answers.0: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It was very important.Ã‚Â  Any time you get a lead in this series, it's important, no matter if it's a double digit lead or oneâ€‘point lead, because both teams are playing great basketball.Ã‚Â  Any time you can get a quick start and get a lead, it helps.
answers.1: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  He's been a huge lift.Ã‚Â  He's been a huge lift for us.Ã‚Â  He's shooting the ball extremely well from the outside.Ã‚Â  He's making plays both offensively and defensively.Ã‚Â  We're going to need it.Ã‚Â  We're going to need it.Ã‚Â  The series is going to be so tight that we're going to need guys to step up, and Shane has been there in the first two games.
answers.2: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  We've just got to continue to do what our staples are, try to get back in transition, level them off, make them take contested shots.Ã‚Â  They're very good when you miss a shot or you turn the ball over at getting out and getting early buckets.Ã‚Â  We've got to continue to be conscious about our turnovers, and then when we miss a shot we've got to have three guys back just to try to level them off and not allow them to get those transition buckets.
answers.3: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  It meant everything.Ã‚Â  We had played too well in the first 36 minutes to try to let this one slip away from us.Ã‚Â  We knew we were going to keep coming.Ã‚Â  We knew they were going to keep fighting.Ã‚Â  They've been doing it the whole postseason against all the teams they've played against, especially on their home floor.Ã‚Â  We just wanted to make one more or two more plays than they made and come out with a victory, and we was able to do that.
answers.4: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  For me it's all about aggression.Ã‚Â  You know, I just try to get into the paint, make things happen, create for myself, create for others and put some pressure on their defense.Ã‚Â  For me that's what my game is all built around.
answers.5: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I mean, for me, I want to guard the best and the biggest point of the game.Ã‚Â  KD is an unbelievable talent.Ã‚Â  I think we all know that, we all see that.Ã‚Â  He can make every shot on the floor.Ã‚Â  Just try to keep a body on him, take contested shots.Ã‚Â  He got away from me a couple times, got a couple threes that I am not too happy about.Ã‚Â  So I'll watch the film and try to figure that out.Ã‚Â  On the last play they were down two and I figured they were going to go to him.Ã‚Â  He got a small step on me, I just wanted to try to keep a body on him, make him take a tough shot, and he's made tough shots all year, all series, and just that one he missed it.
answers.6: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, when you get to the championship, teams got to win on each other's floor.Ã‚Â  The twoâ€‘threeâ€‘two doesn't mean much, I guess.Ã‚Â  I don't know, you've got toâ€‘â€‘ these are the two best teams.Ã‚Â  They're confident no matter what building they're in.Ã‚Â  We're happy now that it's a 1â€‘1 series and we're going back to Miami and will take control of the home court.Ã‚Â  It doesn't mean that the series has changed.Ã‚Â  Both teams can win on each other's floor, and both teams are confident.
answers.7: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, as a competitor, of course you would have been angry.Ã‚Â  Like I said, I just tried to keep a body on him and make him take a tough one.
answers.8: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Shane has been huge.Ã‚Â  Going against him in my career, I understood how smart he was, I understood how competitive he was, especially on the defensive end.Ã‚Â  I was very excited when we was able to sign him in the off season.Ã‚Â  He's a big part of why we're here today and competing for a championship.Ã‚Â  He's meant a lot for our team, he's meant a lot to me, being able to guard guys as well as the top scorers.Ã‚Â  He did it against Carmelo Anthony, from Carmelo Anthony to David West to Paul Pierce and Brandon Bass all the way down to Ibaka and Kevin Durant.Ã‚Â  He can guard multiple positions and allows our team to have so many options defensively.Ã‚Â  He plays a big part in that.
answers.9: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, I'm a confident guy.Ã‚Â  On a big stage like this in a big game like this, every point counts, every point matters.Ã‚Â  So you go to the freeâ€‘throw line, no matter how hostile the environment, and try to knock them down.Ã‚Â  You live with your routine, things you practice all year, and you live with the results.Ã‚Â  Like I said, I'm happy that I was able to go up there and make a few plays, go up there and make my free throws.Ã‚Â  We needed it.Ã‚Â  We needed every point tonight.
answers.10: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  That's justâ€‘â€‘ we want to make enough plays to win basketball games, not to answer any questions about what people have to say about us.
answers.11: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, it's a huge game for us.Ã‚Â  We understood that we wanted to split.Ã‚Â  We had an opportunity in Game 1, but it kind of slipped away from us in the fourth quarter, they took control of the game.Ã‚Â  And Game 2, we wanted to come out and get the win.Ã‚Â  We didn't want to go home being down 0â€‘2 even having three games on our home floor.Ã‚Â  It was good to see the sense of urgency to start the game, and then late in the game make enough plays to even the series.
answers.12: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  You know, for me I always want to be aggressive, and I don't think there was just one guy that can guard me.Ã‚Â  You know, I'm always looking at the next line of defense and seeing the rotation coming.Ã‚Â  Sometimes it doesn't work in my favor.Ã‚Â  I got into the hole one time, Ibaka got me from behind, got a block.Ã‚Â  But I don't think it's just one guy.Ã‚Â  You can't just put one guy on me and allow him to be on an island and defend me oneâ€‘onâ€‘one.Ã‚Â  It's about being aggressive and taking what the defense gives me.Ã‚Â  When I shoot double digit free throws, that means I know personally I'm being aggressive when I'm getting to the rim.Ã‚Â  At the end of the day, it's helping our team. answers.6: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Absolutely, I tell him a lot.Ã‚Â  A lot of times I try to let him figure it out on his own, but sometimes I go to him and tell him I need one of those games from him, I need one of those performances from him because he still has it.Ã‚Â  He knows he still has it, too, but every player needs a little kick every now and then, no matter how time tested they are.Ã‚Â  Yeah, I try to continue to let him know how important he is to this team, which he should know, but he also needs to be D Wade and not worry about deferring as much.
answers.7: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I'm not surprised because it's nowhere near close to last year.Ã‚Â  This year it's happened maybe a handful of times, I can probably count on my hands as many times it happened as much basketball as we play.Ã‚Â  Last year it happened a lot.Ã‚Â  It happened every week or every other week where we was trying to figure out ways we can help our team or we can figure out ways we can help one another.Ã‚Â  But it wasn't happened much this year, so it's not surprising when it comes up.Ã‚Â  It's just reassurance.

answers.11: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  I mean, when you're at ease, honestly, the game becomes very easy for you.Ã‚Â  For me it's just once I was comfortable with everything that was going on off the court, I was able just to let my preparation and all the years that I've put into playing the game of basketball just take care of itself.Ã‚Â  I know how much work I've put into the game, and I don't disâ€‘appreciate the game in no way, I don't take it for granted me being in the position I'm in.Ã‚Â  I kind of let it take care of itself, and it rewards me.
answers.12: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, it's a fine line, honestly, especially now being in The Finals.Ã‚Â  There's always times where you would like to get a minute here, a minute there, two minutes there, and I've got to be more out with my coaching staff, as well, when I feel like I may need a minute here or a minute there and then I can go back into the game.Ã‚Â  But there's also times where I may feel tired, but I'm playing well, we're playing well, so I don't want to mess up the rhythm, and this is a rhythm game.Ã‚Â  It's a fine line with getting rest and just playing through it because I don't feel like I hurt my teammates when I am out there.Ã‚Â  But it's just all about a communication thing, getting twoâ€‘minutes rest here, threeâ€‘minutes there.Ã‚Â  It may can help.
answers.13: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I mean, any time the timeouts or the TV timeouts, the breaks, halftime, you get rest, you're able to recoup and reenergize.Ã‚Â  I mean, it helps.

answers.16: LEBRON JAMES:Ã‚Â  Well, I mean, every game is its own.Ã‚Â  Sometimes we're good, we're great when we're playing our twoâ€‘man game, and other times it has our offense stagnant and it's not allowing us to get the ball from one side to the other.Ã‚Â  I think we're very good offensively and in the half court when we're attacking, no matter what we're doing, either we're playing twoâ€‘man game or we're moving the ball from one side to the other and we're attacking the rim and getting to the freeâ€‘throw line.Ã‚Â  So that's when we're at our best. answers.0: DWYANE WADE:Ã‚Â  I thought coming out of the third quarter they did a great job of turning up defensive pressure to get right back in it.Ã‚Â  From that point it was pretty much a oneâ€‘possession kind of game.Ã‚Â  You know, they just made more plays than us.Ã‚Â  They got a couple offensive rebounds that kind of hurt us.Ã‚Â  They got a couple open shots, and then from that point, we was kind of playing behind.
